messages.message: for the start.sh we can start it only for local runs (by env variable check)

and we can have a group dependency@poetry:
https://python-poetry.org/docs/managing-dependencies/
e.g. place debugpy in dev
Yah. That plus build arguments was the plan. I just wanted a proof of concept.
The main challenge is that we need the debugger running in the docker image.
Is it working now with both local and crafting runs?
Not sure what you mean by local.

one which you run from console in IDE, aka
```cs stop api-server && cd ~/instabase/webserver/api-server/ && make clean build runlocal```
I think runlocal uses start-local.sh or something.
i think just handling the docker case (ie what's used by `cs start webapp` / `make build-docker run-docker`) should be sufficient!

> I think runlocal uses start-local.sh or something.
ok, I made api server local run to be debuggable completely without additional configuration using the idea from your PR:
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/71347
Updated my pr to use a docker build arg and env var.
@Cody Boggs Can you take a look at it? https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/71309
